newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Olympia waiting for reply on licence.
newsitem.headline: Olympia waiting for reply on licence.

text.p: Olympia Industries Bhd said its wholly-owned gaming unit Diriwan Corp Sdn Bhd has applied for trading licenses from the Sabah state chief minister's office and is still awaiting a reply.

In a statement sent to the Kuala Lumpur Stock Exchange late on Monday, Olympia requested that trading in its stock be resumed. Shares of Olympia, which had last traded on March 21, slipped 51 cents to 2.33 ringgit in Tuesday morning trading.
On April 4, Olympia said it had obtained a gaming licence from the Ministry of Finance for its operations in eastern Sabah state. The ministry had revoked Olympia's gaming licence last January.
The ministry later renewed the licence but the Sabah state government refused to allow the renewal.
Diriwan had the gaming licence for Lotteries Corp Sdn Bhd which operated about 200 gaming outlets in Sabah before the licence was revoked.
The dispute has been in a standoff for months. Deputy Finance Minister Affifudin Omar said in January that Sabah state has the final say in allowing the lottery operations.
